work.name: HOK
work.summary:
+ Tier 1-3 support of hardware, software systems, and peripherals; including networking LAN and WLAN management. 
+ Support global user-base on weekly basis via helpdesk ticketing system. 
+ Provisioning and configuration of employee accounts and equipment throughout their life cycles. 
+ Created technical documentation of processes and systems, as well as provided training sessions for staff. 
+ Directly support of at most four offices at a time, equating to 200+ users in four cities. 
+ Personal responsibility for fostering a ‚Äògreen workplace‚Äô through sustainable work practices and technology policy.

references.name: Sysouk Vongphasouk
references.reference:
It was a true pleasure knowing and working with Kiel while he ventured his career in the Southern California area. Kiel extrudes great confidence and positive energy.  Along with his upbeat spirit and team attitude, he is one of few, who makes the work environment feel that more enjoyable for all of his fellow peers.

He is very knowledgeable in the IT field with a leading presence in helping others understand its complexity. He shows great professional curiosity while controlling his patience.  Kiel is organized, focus and has the determination to achieve results.

Kiel's unique style and coolness is one of a kind.  It complements his positive attitude and I highly recommend knowing and anyway being part of Kiel.

references.name: Keith Wanser, CPD
references.reference: Kiel is a great Plumbing / Fire Protection designer.   He has good design techniques and works great in a team.  He is easy to get along with and has much knowledge in his field.  I can think of a few projects I could not have gotten through if it weren't for brainstorming with Kiel!  I hope one day to possibly have the chance to work with him again.

projects.name: "The MoBB"
projects.summary:
‚Ä¢ Map-based PWA; a crowd sourced and curated database of black-owned businesses in the USA with 1400+ listings
‚Ä¢ Meteor, MongoDB, Google Analytics API, materialize-css, opengraph-io API, IpInfo API, Yelp API, Google Places API
‚Ä¢ Opengraph API to pull the most recent images for each business
‚Ä¢ Reactive geolocation-based ‚Äúnearest business‚Äù suggestions

projects.name: The Diligent Citizen
projects.summary:
‚Ä¢ Allowing end-users to be involved in the political decision-making process down to the district level, starting with a simple zipcode search
‚Ä¢ Meteor, MongoDB, OpenData.gov API, SunlightLabs API
‚Ä¢ Zipcode-based search for all district-related data via various APIs
‚Ä¢ Pre-filled contact forms and templates
‚Ä¢ Wordcloud to display trends in local bills/policies

projects.name: "P+WITW"
projects.summary:
‚Ä¢ Location-based asset management web-app with over 2700 data points. 
‚Ä¢ React, Redux, Material-UI, Google Maps API, ipInfo API, restDB API, MySQL, SASS, recharts, chromaJS, date-fns, material-table 
‚Ä¢ PowerShell script as ‚Äúagent‚Äù on each asset, reports to mSQL DB
‚Ä¢ ExpressJS API server communicates with mSQL DB and uses React and Google Maps to display graphs and asset locations
‚Ä¢ End users may search, filter, sort and print data with material-table, view reactive svg charts with two-color interpolation and variable data points

projects.name: wHY Architecture Consulting
